titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale Law Library Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig and Michael Lotstein

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 07:34

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of memoranda, surveys, reports, policies, lectures, donor correspondence and journals documenting the holdings and operations of the Yale Law Library.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 26-E (YRG 26-E), Records of departments, offices, programs, and project of the Yale Law School.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale Law Library Records (RU 786). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of memoranda, surveys, reports, policies, lectures, donor correspondence and journals documenting the holdings and operations of the Yale Law Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the University of Illinois, 2011.

did.unittitle: Manuscripts - Jerome Frank (Transferred to Jerome Frank Papers MS# 222)
Law School Administrative Committee on Security
Women of Color and the Law Collective
American Institute of Architects' Award of Excellence
American Institute of Architects' Honor Award
Notes and Drafts for Frederick Hicks' History of Law and Other Books
Prudential Committee Excerpts Regarding the Law Schools
Juris Prudence: Notes on Opinions of Some Modern Writers
Copies of Financial Papers, Correspondence, etc.
Typed Draft: William Howard Taft Yale Professor of Law and New Haven Citizen. Frederic C. Hicks
Notes on Taft, W. H. from the Journal Courrier

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of donor correspondence; documents pertaining to performance and promotion policies and procedures for law library employees; and documents pertaining to transfers of materials from the law library to other libraries and archival repositories.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The records are restricted until January 1, 2042.

did.unittitle: Yale Law Library manuscripts - transfer files
